revised_title: Structural Analysis of Crystals Found in Nematodirus battus Intestine
tldr: Researchers discovered crystals in the intestine of Nematodirus battus, a nematode parasite of young lambs. They used electron microscopy and image processing techniques to study the molecular structure of these crystals. The crystals have a lattice structure with unit cell dimensions of 16 nm x 23 nm. The researchers considered the possibility of an immunological significance for these crystals and discussed their findings in detail.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Structural Biology
